Description: List of groups the agent belongs to.
Operating system name, without the version.
Operating system name, without the version.
Operating system platform (such centos, ubuntu, windows).
Which commercial OS family (one of: linux, macos, unix, windows, ios or android).
Operating system version as a raw string.

Example: "The password history setting determines the number of unique new passwords a user must use before an old password can be reused."

Description: The ID of the SCA policy check.

Example: Ensure 'Enforce password history' is set to '24 or more password(s)'.
Description: The name of the SCA policy check.

Example: "The longer a user uses the same password, the more likely it is that the password will be compromised."
Description: The reason for the check. Why it is important.

Example: "The password history setting is not set to 24 or more password(s)."
"To establish the recommended configuration, set the following registry value to 24 or more password(s):"
Description: Actions to take to remediate the check.

Example: "[\"c:net.exe accounts -> n:Maximum password age \(days\):\s+(\d+) compare > 0\"," > "\"c:net.exe accounts -> n:Length of password history maintained:\s+(\d+) compare >= 24\"]"

Description: SHA1 hash used as checksum of the data collected by the agent.

Example: "The CIS Microsoft Windows 11 Enterprise Benchmark v1.0.0 is a comprehensive security configuration guide that provides prescriptive guidance for establishing a secure baseline configuration for Microsoft Windows 11 Enterprise."

Description: The file name of the SCA policy.
The ID of the SCA policy.

Example: CIS Microsoft Windows 11 Enterprise Benchmark v1.0.0
Description: The name of the SCA policy.
Date/time when the state was last modified.
